title: Rant: Year of Linux on the desktop
dot: digraph LinuxJourney{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box, style=filled, color=lightgray];subgraph cluster_early{label="Early Years (1991-1994)";"1991: Hobbyist Kernel Impossible"[label="1991: It's not possible for a hobbyist to write their own operating system kernel."];"1992: Kernel Without Networking/Desktop"[label="1992: Kernel exists, but lacks networking/desktop; not useful."];"1993: Toy Desktop"[label="1993: Desktop exists, but lacks drag & drop; a toy."];"1994: PC Only"[label="1994: Only runs on PC, not other computers."];}subgraph cluster_growth{label="Growth & Skepticism (1997-2006)";"1997: Hobbyists Only"[label="1997: Only hobbyists use Linux; not for important tasks."];"1998: No Corporate Investment"[label="1998: Corporations won't invest in free software."];"2000: IT Industry Threat"[label="2000: Linux/free software are a cancer on IT industry."];"2001: Post-Dotcom Decline"[label="2001: Linux will die post-dotcom bubble; no profit."];"2003: Difficult Installation"[label="2003: Linux is too hard to install."];"2005: Ubuntu Toy"[label="2005: Ubuntu is just a toy."];"2006: Server Only"[label="2006: Linux will never work on phones/embedded devices."];}subgraph cluster_success{label="Success & Persistence (2022)";"2022: Global Dominance"[label="2022: Runs on supercomputers, devices, servers, Mars."];"2022: New Problems"[label="2022: Still a toy unless solves new problems."];}subgraph cluster_reflection{label="Reflection (2023)";"2023: 30 Years"[label="2023: 30 years of Linux on desktop; skepticism persists."];}"1991: Hobbyist Kernel Impossible"->"1992: Kernel Without Networking/Desktop";"1992: Kernel Without Networking/Desktop"->"1993: Toy Desktop";"1993: Toy Desktop"->"1994: PC Only";"1994: PC Only"->"1997: Hobbyists Only";"1997: Hobbyists Only"->"1998: No Corporate Investment";"1998: No Corporate Investment"->"2000: IT Industry Threat";"2000: IT Industry Threat"->"2001: Post-Dotcom Decline";"2001: Post-Dotcom Decline"->"2003: Difficult Installation";"2003: Difficult Installation"->"2005: Ubuntu Toy";"2005: Ubuntu Toy"->"2006: Server Only";"2006: Server Only"->"2022: Global Dominance";"2022: Global Dominance"->"2022: New Problems";"2022: New Problems"->"2023: 30 Years";{rank=same;"2022: Global Dominance", "2022: New Problems"}}

title: Compromised PyTorch-nightly dependency chain between December 25th – December 30
dot:
digraph PyTorchIncident{rankdir=LR;node[shape=rectangle, style=filled, color=lightgray];PyTorchNightly[label="PyTorch-nightly
Dec 25-30, 2022", color=lightcoral];TorchTriton[label="torchtriton
(compromised)", color=lightcoral];PythonEnv[label="Python Environment"];MaliciousBinary[label="Malicious Binary
(triton)", color=lightcoral];SupplyChainAttack[label="Supply Chain Attack", color=lightcoral];StablePackages[label="PyTorch Stable Packages
(Not Affected)", color=lightgreen];PyTorchNightly->TorchTriton[label="dependency"];TorchTriton->PythonEnv[label="installed via pip"];TorchTriton->MaliciousBinary;MaliciousBinary->SupplyChainAttack[label="sensitive data
upload"];TorchTriton->StablePackages[label="not affected", style=dashed];subgraph cluster_mitigation{label="Mitigation Steps";style=filled;color=lightblue; RemoveDependency[label="Remove torchtriton
dependency"];ReplaceWithDummy[label="Replace with dummy
package on PyPI"];RemoveNightly[label="Remove compromised
nightly packages"];ContactPyPI[label="Contact PyPI security
team"];RemoveDependency->ReplaceWithDummy->RemoveNightly->ContactPyPI;}TorchTriton->cluster_mitigation;}

title: Easy, alternative soft deletion: `deleted_record_insert`
dot:
digraph SoftDeletionAlternative{node[shape=box, style=filled, color=lightblue];subgraph cluster_legacy{label="Legacy Soft Deletion";deleted_at_col[label="`deleted_at` column", shape=box];problems[label="Issues:
- Query complexity
- Foreign key problems", shape=plaintext];deleted_at_col->problems;}subgraph cluster_alternative{label="Alternative: `deleted_record`";deleted_record_table[label="`deleted_record` table", shape=box];function[label="`deleted_record_insert()` function", shape=box];trigger[label="Triggers on deletion", shape=box];deleted_record_table->function[label="Data storage"];function->trigger[label="Automatic insertion"];}cluster_legacy->cluster_alternative[label="Migration"];problems->cluster_alternative[label="Resolution"];benefits[label="Benefits:
- Simplified queries
- No FK issues
- Reduced bugs", shape=plaintext];cluster_alternative->benefits;note[label="A++ programming pattern.
Would implement again.", shape=ellipse, style=filled, color=lightgreen];benefits->note;}

title: The internet wants to be fragmented
dot: digraph InternetEvolution{node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor="#f0f8ff", fontname="Arial"];edge[fontname="Arial"]; subgraph cluster_0{label="Early Internet";style=filled;color=lightgrey;"Usenet"->"IRC"->"Web Forums"->"MUSHes/MUDs";"Community Moderation"[shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#e6e6fa"];"Usenet"->"Community Moderation";"IRC"->"Community Moderation";"Web Forums"->"Community Moderation";"MUSHes/MUDs"->"Community Moderation";} subgraph cluster_1{label="Centralized Social Media";style=filled;color=lightgrey;"Facebook"->"Twitter"->"Instagram";"Centralized Moderation"[shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#e6e6fa"];"Facebook"->"Centralized Moderation";"Twitter"->"Centralized Moderation";"Instagram"->"Centralized Moderation";"Loss of Community"[shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#ffebcd"];"Centralized Moderation"->"Loss of Community";"Network Effects"->"Centralized Moderation";} subgraph cluster_2{label="Fragmented Future";style=filled;color=lightgrey;"TikTok"->"YouTube";"Snapchat"->"Instagram";"WhatsApp"->"Signal"->"Discord";"Fragmentation"[shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#e6e6fa"];"TikTok"->"Fragmentation";"YouTube"->"Fragmentation";"Snapchat"->"Fragmentation";"Instagram"->"Fragmentation";"WhatsApp"->"Fragmentation";"Signal"->"Fragmentation";"Discord"->"Fragmentation";} "Early Internet"->"Centralized Social Media"[label="Transition"];"Centralized Social Media"->"Fragmented Future"[label="Return to Fragmentation"];}
